Class Cursor

java.lang.Object
  




public class Cursor
extends greenfoot.Actor

The cursor moves around in the world and chooses a location to add the shooter. It will only add the shooter if space is available, and there is no other shooter occupying the space. Its image will update depending on the shooter chosen to add to the world.

Version:
June 2018
Author:
Amber Chen, Maggie Lin, Catherine Lee

Constructor Summary
Cursor()
          Creates a cursor that will appear to place shooters in world.
 
Method Summary
 void act()
          The cursor will snap to the grid in the world, as opposed to moving freely.
 boolean checkIfSpaceIsAvailable()

 void combineImage(greenfoot.GreenfootImage image)
          Adds image of which shooter is being added to the image of cursor so user knows which shooter has been selected.
 void resetImage()
          Resets image so there is no shooter within the cursor.
 void update()

Constructor Detail

Cursor

public Cursor()
Creates a cursor that will appear to place shooters in world.

Method Detail

act

public void act()
The cursor will snap to the grid in the world, as opposed to moving freely. This method is called whenever the 'Act' or 'Run' button gets pressed in the environment.

Overrides:
act in class greenfoot.Actor

checkIfSpaceIsAvailable

public boolean checkIfSpaceIsAvailable()
See if space is available at certain location in grid.

Returns:
boolean True if space is available, otherwise false

combineImage

public void combineImage(greenfoot.GreenfootImage image)
Adds image of which shooter is being added to the image of cursor so user knows which shooter has been selected.

Parameters:
image - Image to combine cursor image with

resetImage

public void resetImage()
Resets image so there is no shooter within the cursor.

update

public void update()
Updates the cursor. The size of the grid changes depending on the level, so the update method can adjust the grid's properties accordingly.
